byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong, and Jane Perlez from Beijing.
byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and JANE PERLEZ

abstract: China suspends rule that would have pushed foreign technology companies out of its banking sector, confronting issue that had become flashpoint in brewing trade conflict with the United States; suspension is only temporary, and will be supplanted by new rules that could still present serious problems for multinational tech companies seeking to preserve billions in business in the sector.
lead_paragraph: The rules, which called for companies that sell computer equipment to reveal secret code, have been at the center of a trade conflict with the United States.

headline.main: China Halts New Policy on Tech for Banks
headline.print_headline: China Halts New Policy on Tech for Banks

snippet: The rules, which called for companies that sell computer equipment to reveal secret code, have been at the center of a trade conflict with the United States.
